p: Regarding the ecosystem and agriculture, Liu found that a 1 °C temperature rise could reduce wheat output by 5.7% (95% confidence interval ranges from 4.0% to 6.9%) [ 6]. A similar research study of Asseng showed 1 °C warming could lead to 6% reduction of wheat output, which is equivalent to one-quarter of wheat trade volume worldwide if no adaptive measures are taken [ 7].
